questions.text: Which condition is inherited according to the given pedigree?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome Above pedigree shows female is a carrier and transmitting the disease to all offsprings, which will be manifested in male (as having single X chromosome) and carrier in female. Affected male does not transmit the disorder to his sons.

Highyeild:

X linked recessive trait Location of mutant gene: It is on the X chromosome and there is no male-to-male transmission. Required number of defective gene: One copy for the manifestation of disease in males, but two copies are needed in females. Sex affected: Males are more frequently affected than females; daughters of affected male are all asymptomatic carriers. Affected male does not transmit the disorder to his sons. Pattern of inheritance: Transmission is through a female carrier (heterozygous). Example of X linked recessive disorder System affected Examples Blood ● Hemophilia A and B ● Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency ● Chronic granulomatous disease Musculoskeletal system ● Duchenne muscular dystrophy Nervous system ● Fragile-X syndrome Metabolic disorders ● Diabetes insipidus ● Lesch-Nyhan syndrome Immune systems ● Agammaglobulinemia ● Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome

questions.text: A 6-month-old child presented with leucocoria (cat's eye reflex) in the right eye. A cranial pathology was detected. The lesion is positive for synaptophysin, NSE, and chromogranin, and shows a palisade in a spoke-and- wheel arrangement, surrounding a central core. Identify the condition: NSE-Neuron specific enolase
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Retinoblastoma A 6 month old baby with leucocoria (cat's eye reflex) in the right eye, is suggestive of retinoblastoma, which on IHC shows positivity for synaptophysin, chromogranine, and NSE

Highyeild:

Retinoblastoma is the most common malignant eye tumor of childhood. 90% cases are diagnosed before 7 years. Hereditary retinoblastoma when affecting both eyes is called bilateral retinoblastoma. Bilateral retinoblastoma + pineal gland tumor in the suprasellar or parasellar region is called Trilateral retinoblastoma. These tumors arise from neuroepithelium of the retina A characteristic feature is Flexner Wintersteiner rosettes consisting of clusters of cuboidal or short columnar cells arranged around a central lumen. The nuclei are displaced away from the lumen and photoreceptor-like elements are produced from it. Retinoblastoma also shows Homer Wright rosettes which are radial arrangement of cells around a central tangle of fibrils. Fleurettes representing photoreceptor differentiation of tumor cells are also seen.

The characteristic periosteal reaction produces layers of reactive bone deposited in an onion-skin fashion . Pathogenesis- classic translocation is t(11;22) translocation (q24;q12) and the most common fusion gene (EWSR1-FLI 1) generated acts as the dominant oncogene to stimulate cell proliferation Gross- Ewing sarcoma usually arises in the medullary cavity and invades the cortex, periosteum, and soft tissue The tumor is soft, tan-white , and frequently contains areas of hemorrhage and necrosis Histology- It is composed of sheets of uniform small, round cells with scant cytoplasm that may be clear due to abundant glycogen Homer-Wright rosettes, when tumor cells are arranged in a circle about a central fibrillary space, indicative neuroectodermal differentiation .
